name: Ritz-Carlton Grand Cayman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went for our honeymoon and were not disappointed with our choice of the Ritz Cayman. We stayed on the Club level and would HIGHLY recommend making the jump to Club. Ask for the special drink menu that they have (list of island drinks on a front and back sheet) and enjoy the awesome food available in the club room (Shrimp night was our favorite, they were some of the biggest we've ever seen!). The food, while expensive (but hey, everything in the Cayman's is relatively pricey), was outstanding overall - we ate at all the restaurants on site and had room service several times. And as people have mentioned, Blue is worth the jaw-dropping prices....One thing we were concerned about was all the reviews about children at the resort. To address this, yes there were a few kids running around but we weren't bothered in the least. We'd recommend this hotel because you know what you're going to get: fantastic Ritz service, great rooms, and beautiful beaches and some of the clearest water we've ever seen.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon!
The best place to stay in grand cayman
reviews.text: We are just completing our stay in grand cayman at the Ritz Carlton. We have been to the island 7 times now and always find a well maintained property as well as a very friendly and welcoming staff. Since our last visit the hotel has offered things "included" such as valet parking, use of spa or workout room, use of water sport equipment and much more. As we checked in we were offered a nice chilled juice and some cookies- a very nice touch. Our ocean front room was very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will return again.
reviews.title: great 1st time experience at a ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: my 1st time ever review on trip advisor. wife and i went for our anniversary in may and loved the hotel. service was impeccable. everything was pricey, but if you don't mind paying for high quality service then this is the place for you. ate at the sushi restaurant which was fantastic. pool and poolside service was also great. if you are going for a special occasion, let them know and they will probably add a special touch to your trip.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels. Period.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a top of the line hotel. You pay for it. There were no ocean suites left, and so they upgraded us to a presidential suite. The patio overlooking 7 mile beach was at least 1,000 square feet. luxurious and spacious rooms. Great service. The gym was outstanding, and the sanctuary was a place to soak I the hit tub and steam rooms. you can sit on loungers in the ocean and have meals brought to you.
reviews.title: More like a Marriott than a Ritz Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Ritz, Grand Cayman for 4 nights from June 1 - June 5.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - Fantastic time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself: Soooo nice! I mean...It's a Ritz...you can't go wrong there!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Beautiful views of the pool and beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Impeccable! From the concierge, to the waiters, to the beach/pool staff, to the cleaning staff, we were always catered to...can't complain one bit! We would give the beach/pool staff a tip for putting out the chairs for us and setting us up quite nicely.
reviews.title: excellent !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Food: Didn't have ONE bad dish! Everything was great!
reviews.title: Typical Ritz with fantastic beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High-lite: Eric Ripert's restaurant, Blue--WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The best meal my husband and I have ever had! The service--outstanding!! Yes--I agree with the other reviews, it IS quite pricey (we spend $435 USD for the two of us. We each got the tasting menu and 3 glasses of wine) but OHHH!!! It was sooooooo worth it!!!!!!! This is a MUST-DO!!!!
reviews.title: Great stay but I have some feedback for the folks at the Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a five night stay. After some previous experiences at other Ritz's near beaches (South Beach, Ft. Lauderdale, San Juan), I wasn't sure what kind of Ritz I was going to get. I was very pleased to find it was the level that has made them so well liked.
reviews.title: A Great Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: The room was nice. Nothing spectacular, but large enough with a good amount of storage, a nice bathroom, etc. Only complaint was that the mattress was very soft and seemed like it probably needed replacing. I'd complain about the TV not being a flat screen, but I never turned it on.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Food: We ate the breakfast buffet every morning (included in our room rate through Amex Platinum). It was a great buffet with a lot to choose from (although no variety depending on day). We ate by the pool several times and found that the chicken sandwich was pretty good and reasonably priced at CI$14 with all of the toppings you wanted. The best option IMO were the nachos. Drinks by the pool generally came pretty quickly and there were the standard options. Prices were high, but also keep in mind that Grand Cayman is a VERY expensive island, and I didn't find the Ritz's prices to be that far out of line. I was more shocked when my snorkel tour-boat sold cans of beer for the same price the Ritz was charging at the pool.
reviews.title: Great time at the Ritz Carlton. Eat off site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: This is what truly made the Ritz stand out. Everyone was very friendly, especially to the children staying at the resort. Our bellman took his time telling us about the room (perhaps too long, unless you've never stayed in a hotel room before), and he was charming. Everyone else was very helpful and friendly, especially at breakfast. Service often makes or breaks hotels like this one (i.e. both South Beach and San Juan had employees that thought you should be serving them because they were so cool for working at the Ritz), and the service makes this one great.
reviews.title: KEEP JEWELRY IN YOUR CARRY ON!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Amenities: We were upgraded to an Oceanfront room and never went to the pool on the other side of the resort. Plenty of beach and pool chairs (it seemed to be a pretty quiet time between spring breaks and summer vacations) and they even seemed to have enough umbrellas most days. There was very nice snorkel equipment to borrow and nice kayaks and paddleboards to take out on the water, along with a water tricycle. I took a shower in my room exactly one time because I went to the fitness center and spa the other days. The fitness center was very nice (although kept at too warm a temperature) and the spa facilities (whirlpool, steam room, sauna) were top notch, along with the locker room attendants. They should add a cold plunge pool given how warm everything else was (sauna was close to 180, whirlpool very warm, and the locker room was probably in the low 80's).
reviews.title: Just Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Service was great. Always available and never pushy. They just have a knack for knowing what the right amount of attention to each customer should be. Beach was amazing. Water was so clear and warm.
reviews.title: Ritz is always at the top with service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food and drinks great. Pricey, but you get what you pay for. Only down side of the resort is it's lack of tropical feel. I think all the Ritz and Four Seasons always opt for a more upscale look, but the Cayman Ritz does need some new carpet in the halls and a little more atmosphere in the lobbies and hallways. Had A great time. The island itself is very quiet and safe. Loved that about it. Most rooms are not Ocean View, most Ocean view rooms are part of the timeshare program. Not a big deal. I would love to go back.
reviews.title: Agree with previous review 100 percent...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spa is amazing!!!!!!!!!!! Don;t miss it if you go.
reviews.title: The Ritz doesn't bring this baby home for the 5 star resort junkie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a lot of night life. Music shuts down at 10:00 at most nights. Great place for relaxation for couples, families, business and anyone who wants to chill.
reviews.title: I've been around the world... the Ritz Cayman takes the cake!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our third visit to the Ritz Carlton during March spring break and the first time that the hotel was overrun with corporate meetings and people. We were disappointed that everywhere people had badges from their corporate meetings, busses taking them on excursions etc.. Seemed more like Disney than a Ritz. In addition, as the other review pointed out, the beach was set up for many corporate events, again not what one would expect during a family time of year. The chair situation on the beach has also worsened as many get up as early as 7 as the reviewer pointed out and take lounge chairs with pails and shovels on them to save , only never to be used by the 3-7 year olds they save them for.The beach staff does try hard as does the restaurant staff. This year during the morning buffet which is pricey, the wait staff never asked to refill coffee or tea, etc and seemed completely overwhelmed with the number of guests and not as well trained as in previous years although they were always smiling and very friendly. as the other review pointed out 17-20 us dollars for a drink on the beach is a bit crazy and definitely not warranted. We too have travelled to no less than 5 star resorts and the one point that bothered us completely, there was no set price for a ritz kids meal plan for under 12, nor was there a ritz kids meal like the Ritz in Naples, or Key Biscayne meaning that a hot dog for 15 us dollars with tax and added gratuity was simply that a six inch hot dog with a few fries. Not the side order of something with the fruit cookie/ drink that the other Ritz resorts offer. With the price of the rooms etc, the resort should offer its youngest guests more than that! The golf and tennis instruction is wonderful.. and the island is clean and friendly. The resort overall is great but the price given what is recieved for many will be a disappointment.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Ritz in Grand Cayman is without question one the best places to stay without question in the Caribbean. The rooms, the staff, the food, the accessibility to the beach and pools makes it effortless to relax and enjoy your stay/vacation.
reviews.title: Perfection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel, the staff went out of their way for the most part, the only not so great experience was in one of the restaurants - Periwinkle,food was not good and the service was average at best. the grounds are beautiful, pool service as very good, passed watermelon, wet towels. Wish they had more rafts for the pool, only 2. all in all a very good stay
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow. Just got back from the Ritz at Grand Cayman. This is the best Ritz Carlton that I have visited including, Maui, Jamaica and St Thomas. Blue by Eric Ripert, while expensive, is truly a 5 star restaurant. The hand written thank you note from our servers was quite unexpected. The snorkeling right in front of the hotel in crystal blue water was outstanding. Saw stingrays and turtles just outside the swim area. The staff was the best part of our stay along with our upgrade to a suite out of the blue. I'm already planning our next trip and we got back at 7:00pm tonight.
reviews.title: Ritz of the Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the week of July 4 at this luxurious and beautiful resort. The experience was right up there with resorts we have stayed at in Maui and the West Coast. The staff was very warm and the service had a personal touch to it. Both pools on the resort are very warm, refreshing and inviting. The property was nearly immaculate as well as our room. The food at the Ritz is very expensive, but extremely well-prepared. The memories you will have staying at this property will be something to cherish.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to go to Grand Cayman at the last minute over July 4th. We could not have made a better choice than the Ritz-Carlton and service from the staff while there was impeccable. Stephano remember what drinks we ordered and made them perfectly each time! We would absolutely recommend this hotel to others and thanks for all the reviews on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: AWESOME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited in July 2011 and decided to return again this year. Spent a week in an oceanfront room. Loved it. Just all around fabulous resort with excellent service. Highly recommend. We will be back.
reviews.title: Second stay at the Ritz Grand Cayman - Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Couple of thoughts:
reviews.title: After visiting quite a few hotels on the island, the Ritz is hands down the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: -we liked the restaurant Seven. we were told that they will be remodeling Seven this fall -- will be an improvement, I think. Great food, but the atmosphere is a little lacking.
reviews.title: Best service I've had in a long time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: -the Cupboard shop needs breakfast sandwiches -- options are limited to croissants and pastries mostly -- would be great to have a quick egg/bacon type of option without having to order room service or sit in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Beautiful weather and perfect property...you never need to leave the resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -expensive. know this going in and you won't be surprised.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: we have stayed at the Ritz for the last three years and continue to love the island and the property.I would recommend this hotel to any visitor to theCaymans.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel on a beautiful beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton in January for the week and loved it. Traveled with my husband and 21 year old son during his college break. We had a great time and loved everything about this resort.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!
Five Star Hotel At It's Best
reviews.text: Rooms were decent, a little on the small side but the beds are extremely comfy! We stayed on the side across from the beach. It is connected by a hallway which is filled with art and runs above the road over to the beach area. So, you never have to go outside to get to the beach side.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the breakfast buffet every morning, which was delicious. Good variety of food to choose from. Usually ate at the restaurant out by the pool for lunch, which is just ok, and very pricey. A couple of days we did walk over to The Sunshine Grill, which was very good and cheap...at least for CI! Always went out for dinner and our favorite meal was at Casanova's, where we ate right on the water. My family still talks about the lobster crepes. Just be prepared to pay high prices for everything. Nothing on the Island is cheap. Dinner each night for 3 was at least $120 and up! Oh, and remember everything is listed in CI dollars on the menu but they will charge US dollars.
reviews.title: Lived up to Billing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach is fabulous. Never a problem finding chairs and the service was always good. Water is absolutely beautiful here! We booked a snorkel trip/Stingray City through the little place in the strip center next door. This trip took you out by jet skis and we found that was much more fun than previous trips out on a boat.
reviews.title: Best vacation we have had as a family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I entered the Ritz Cayman I was very impressed it was very large and very clean and came across like a Dubai hotel. I then went to the room and again could not really fault at all as was spotless and very clean. Yes it is very big but once you find your way around the building it is easy. I think people are moaning for the sake of it. I understand more if you have a disability or are elderly.
reviews.title: Very Average and Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was looking good once we were settled I ventured down to the beach and this is when my view started to change. The beach area was small for the size of the hotel on a normal day but they had sectioned half of it for a function so everyone was squashed like sardines on the beach. I am one of those people that like space not to be on top of others. There were also lots of screaming bratty kids so not the luxury that the website tries to portray when booking your holiday.
reviews.title: The Ritz is...The Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I went to the manager his attitude was that the hotel mainly concentrates on the corporate business and 90% of the clients that stayed were Americans (not Europeans). He also stated that the beach will be sealed off in parts for the rest of the week and that I had to deal with it. My husband pointed out that the corporate were not paying $1000 dollars a night more like half and that his aggression was not what one would expect from the Ritz.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More importantly we like transparency so all this information should have been on the Ritz website. We were guests of the hotel paying $1000 dollars a night so his attitude was totally unacceptable and he did not seem to care.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: As the week went on the room cleaning went downhill or more importantly the lack of it and so did the service throughout the hotel. It kind of got to the stage where no one cared and had an attitude that you should be grateful to have the sea.. I was actually shocked how relaxed all the Americans were with the bad service, as they have some great beaches in their country. They were paying a hell of a lot and let me tell you there is a lot of competition and better survive around the world that actually want your business.
reviews.title: Great views

description: A Caribbean resort located on exclusive Seven Mile Beach on Grand Cayman, The Ritz-Carlton, Grand Cayman is a short 70-minute flight from Miami. The resort will include 365 guestrooms and 69 of our Residences at The Ritz-Carlton. The resort will also include golf, tennis, La Prairie Spa and seven restaurants.
